Key Match Events: Jonathan Kuminga and Brandin Podziemski displayed star scoring chops to rescue the Warriors from an embarrassing loss to the Rockets.
The Warriors took a 28-point lead into halftime using red-hot shooting and suffocating defense.
Tari Eason and Amen Thompson spearheaded Houston's comeback, with Golden State missing 18 free throws and going six minutes without a field goal.
Draymond Green fouled out with 8.3 seconds left, sending Eason to the free throw line to tie the game.
The Rockets missed their first five shots in overtime, allowing the Warriors to secure a 127-121 victory.
Podziemski made crucial shots in the last few minutes of regulation, including scoring over Jalen Green and Jabari Smith Jr.
Kuminga exploited a size advantage over Green for scores and free throws, taking over in overtime.
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Kerr expressed pride in the team's response to Houston's second-half onslaught and highlighted the importance of the experience for future games.
Podziemski reflected on his scoring approach, emphasizing the importance of playing at his own pace.
Kerr praised Kuminga's ability to beat switches and get downhill, noting his fantastic performance.
